intro: Pimpinella nyingchiensis, commonly known as the Nyingchi pimpinella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a taproot system and compound leaves with a feathery appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
